conclusion: Use the relationship between volume, temperature, and pressure for an ideal gas.
At state A, volume V_A = V_0, pressure p_A = p_0, temperature T_A = T_0.
Line segment AB is parallel to the volume axis, indicating constant volume.
Line segment BC extends from the origin to point C, indicating an increase in volume.
Identify initial conditions at state A: V_A = V_0 and p_A = p_0.
Volume remains constant at V_0 throughout process AB.
From state A to state B, volume increases from V_0 to 2V_0, pressure p_B remains constant at p_0.
From state B to state C, volume increases from 2V_0 to 3V_0, pressure p_C remains constant at p_0.
Since volume increases from 2V_0 to 3V_0, temperature T_C must increase from T_0 to 2T_0.
Relationship between temperature, volume, and pressure: p = (m/V) * (dV/dt).
Rate of change of volume dV/dt is V_0/T_0.
Since p_C = p_0, m/T_0 = p_0, T_C = 2T_0.
The temperature at state C is 2T_0.
